greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A013928(A007947(n)).
comment: For n > 1, a(n) gives the (one-based) index of the column where n is located in array A284311, or respectively, index of the row where n is in A284457. A008479 gives the other index.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: If A008683(n) <> 0 [when n is squarefree, A005117], a(n) = A013928(n), otherwise a(n) = a(A285328(n)).
program: def a007947(n): return 1 if n<2 else reduce(mul, primefactors(n))
def a013928(n): return sum(1 for i in range(1, n) if core(i) == i)
print([a013928(a007947(n)) for n in range(1, 101)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Apr 18 2017
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 17 2017
